Text: RE Great news on Fronterapst UpdateThe deal probably wont be signed until Monday there are some legal issues on the guarantees nothing major its just a logistical issue regarding the availability of the attorneys Ill keep you posted Not to worry its done as far as Im concerned Original Message From Kitchen Louise Sent Friday March PM To Sukaly Bruce Subject Great news on Frontera I do not need anything but would like a copy ofhte contracts just for me to read when you have them Thanks Have a good weekend Louise

TECO Updatepst We received their redraft of the doc yesterday it needed a lot of work We will return the draft on Monday morning We are combining the QSE contract into the Energy Management Agreement In addition there is a master purchase agreement as well This results in quite a bit of legal work TECO indicated they are undermanned at this time and the turnaround will be slow From a business concept standpoint we really dont have any deal killer issues I think we can get the deal done by the quarters end at the latest and probably late next week But then depends on TECOs turnaround time Stuart Zisman and Mark Haedicke are going to meet with Lavo on Wednesday to talk legal risks associated with this deal and these types of deals Ill be there and Ill let you know the time in case your are interested
EA EES Gas Issuespst Following the flowchart for power the Texas gas team feels that EES should handle customers below MMBtuday and EA handles all accounts above that number

RE Fronterapst Actually we have been waiting for TECO to return the draft they we supposed to get it to us on Monday morning We are still waiting We scrapped the trip to Tampa tonight But there are no problems and they still want to proceed I expect to close by Tuesday Ill keep you posted Original Message From Kitchen Louise Sent Wednesday March PM To Sukaly Bruce Subject Frontera Hows it going no pressure just interest

RE EA and EES in ERCOTpst You are correct on the arrow No Janet is seeing this for the first time Ive talked to her regarding we need to have coordination rules and this is our attempt at that issue Original Message From Kitchen Louise Sent Wednesday March AM To Sukaly Bruce Subject Re EA and EES in ERCOT I think the bottom arrow is supposed to be a No or is that just me misinterpreting the diagram Is this something which was just agreed by you and Janet or how long was it in place beforehand Thanks Louise From Bruce nronXgate on AM To Louise CT Janet R ES cc Subject EA and EES in ERCOT Attached is the flow chart that the EA ERCOT team developed regarding Enrons customer approach in Texas If you have any questions please call x File EA EES Customer Interactionppt
EA and EES in ERCOTpst Attached is the flow chart that the EA ERCOT team developed regarding Enrons customer approach in Texas If you have any questions please call x

ERCOT Mid Marketer Cc ERCOT team has met with Joe Des Champs for the Mid Marketing position in our region It is my understanding that you must interview Joe before we can make him a job offer I would like to proceed with the interview process Joe worked for me at Williams as the lead trader in the West Here are my thoughts on Joe and why he is a good fit for our group He has a very good understanding of the trading business especially natural gas in Texas and the western US His personality is a great fit for Texas especially with the loss of Jim Ducote Joe has a lot of successful relationships within Texas and relates well to Texans His initial appearance and manners appear to be easy going and laid back however he is a very agressive and effective trader His command of the physical gas business is outstanding Learns fast and relates well to traders I believe Doug and Joe will work well together Likes to work the phones What he is not He is new to the power business However he served the WilliamsAES plants in California So he is familiar with the power I would be glad to discuss Joe in detail or set up the phone interview I have attached Joes resume Thanks

Beacon Slidesyou pleased put the Enron logo and print a color copy for me Thanks

Tolling off Lincoln Center Cc in the process of firing the off the first shot to Cinergy for a or year toll starting Please provide any comments with regard to pricing etc I just pulled the Capacity charge out of the air I made the year a little lower in hopes of making it more attractive I think a year toll attached to the asset will make it more attractive to the tolling providers of the world AES Calpine Tenaskaetc Let me know your thoughts and concerns before I send this off to Cinergy
